intro: Kotschya strobilantha var. strobilantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is prized for its ornamental value in horticulture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Its unique growth habit and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
